bug.author: kezakool
bug.summary: tf 1.14 compiler error: Espresso exception: "Invalid blob shape": generic_elementwise_kernel
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
Converter issue with a tf 1.12 model containing tf_slim Convolution2D layer. <denchmark-h:h2>Trace</denchmark-h>
Running TensorFlow Graph Passes: 100%|‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà| 6/6 [00:00<00:00, 14.30 passes/s] Converting Frontend ==> MIL Ops: 43%|‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñé | 85/197 [04:00<05:16, 2.83s/ ops] Traceback (most recent call last): File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\coremltools\converters\mil\frontend\tensorflow\converter.py", line 339, in convert_main_graph outputs = convert_graph(self.context, graph, self.outputs) File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\coremltools\converters\mil\frontend\tensorflow\convert_utils.py", line 181, in convert_graph _add_op(context, node) File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\coremltools\converters\mil\frontend\tensorflow\ops.py", line 776, in Conv2D name=conv_name, File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\coremltools\converters\mil\mil\ops\registry.py", line 62, in add_op return cls._add_op(op_cls, **kwargs) File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\coremltools\converters\mil\mil\builder.py", line 191, in _add_op new_op.type_value_inference() File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\coremltools\converters\mil\mil\operation.py", line 178, in type_value_inference output_types = self.type_inference() File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\coremltools\converters\mil\mil\ops\defs\conv.py", line 133, in type_inference custom_pad=custom_pad, File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\coremltools\converters\mil\mil\ops\defs_utils.py", line 231, in spatial_dimensions_out_shape custom_pad=custom_pad, File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\coremltools\converters\mil\mil\ops\defs_utils.py", line 161, in aggregated_pad for i, k, s in zip(input_shape, effective_ks, strides) File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\coremltools\converters\mil\mil\ops\defs_utils.py", line 161, in for i, k, s in zip(input_shape, effective_ks, strides) File "E:\Anaconda3\envs\cartoonize3\lib\site-packages\sympy\core\expr.py", line 327, in float raise TypeError("can't convert expression to float") TypeError: can't convert expression to float <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
If a python script can reproduce the error, please paste the code snippet tf_model_path = os.path.join(export_dir,frozen_model_name) coreml_model_path = os.path.join(export_dir,coreml_model_name) wbc_coreml_model = coremltools.convert(tf_model_path,outputs=['final_add'],source="tensorflow") wbc_coreml_model.save(coreml_model_path)
If applicable, please attach the source model source model : wbc_model_frozen.zip
<denchmark-h:h2>System environment (please complete the following information):</denchmark-h>
coremltools version (e.g., 3.0b5):4.02b OS (e.g., MacOS, Linux): Windows 10 macOS version (if applicable): XCode version (if applicable): How you install python (anaconda, virtualenv, system): conda python version (e.g. 3.7): python 3.6 any other relevant information:
tf 1.12
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
in the mean time i'm trying to replace slim layers with standards tf layers, thx for your help

comments.comment: Hi, replacing with tf standard conv2d didn't fix the problem, did you find anything in the model I provided? I made another try with a saved_model format, no improvement. i'm not sure about it but could it be because the input has a dynamic shape? tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [1, None, None, 3], name='input_image') thx

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/1duo>@1duo</denchmark-link> , I fixed this with setting the input to a static shape (720*720) <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/coremltools/files/5073610/wbc_model_coreml.zip>wbc_model_coreml.zip</denchmark-link>
, before the conversion, conversion was successful, then I set it back to dynamic with flexible_shape_utils.NeuralNetworkImageSizeRange(). but the next error i get is in intermediates layers : coremlc: Error: compiler error: Espresso exception: "Invalid blob shape": generic_elementwise_kernel: cannot broadcast [3, 720, 3, 1, 1] and [1, 720, 720, 1, 1] do you have any workaround to keep dynamic shapes with coreml? you'll find attached the converted model. thx for your help :)

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kezakool>@kezakool</denchmark-link> , we don't really support TF 1.12 which is too old. We only support TF 1.14+: <denchmark-link:https://coremltools.readme.io/docs/what-are-coreml-tools>https://coremltools.readme.io/docs/what-are-coreml-tools</denchmark-link>
Can you try upgrading to TF 1.14? David

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/daiwei89>@daiwei89</denchmark-link> , thx for your answer! :) i did a try with tf1.14, conversion log : Running TensorFlow Graph Passes: 100%|‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà| 6/6 [00:03<00:00, 1.62 passes/s] Converting Frontend ==> MIL Ops: 100%|‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà| 136/136 [00:00<00:00, 2046.54 ops/s] Running MIL optimization passes: 100%|‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà| 14/14 [00:00<00:00, 132.67 passes/s] Translating MIL ==> MLModel Ops: 100%|‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà| 261/261 [00:02<00:00, 116.33 ops/s] same error (even with static inputs shape) when i'm doing a predict : RuntimeError: Error compiling model: "compiler error: Espresso exception: "Invalid blob shape": generic_elementwise_kernel: cannot broadcast [3, 256, 3, 1, 1] and [1, 256, 256, 1, 1]". here is a zip containing infos for reproducing my error : <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/coremltools/files/5157221/reproduce_error_files.zip>reproduce_error_files.zip</denchmark-link>
tf 1.14 saved model format coreml model code .py to reproduce the error
thank you for helping

hi, any idea on this issue? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/1duo>@1duo</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/daiwei89>@daiwei89</denchmark-link>
thx
I'm having this issue too, any update?
hi, i made a new try with the new release 4.0, i still get the same error, can you provide guidance for debugging the tensorflow v1.x conversion? thx for all your work

i made some improvments in the conversion and it become quiet unrelated to the initial topic, i close this issue and open a new one : <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/coremltools/issues/983>#983</denchmark-link>
